intro: Pluchea kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi groundsel, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and wind-pollinated flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow to orange flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability. Pluchea kotschyi is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
